content.description: Two stones are thrown from the same height and with the same initial speed. Stone <math alttext="A" overflow="scroll"> <mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi> </math> is thrown vertically downward, and Stone <math alttext="B" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></math> is thrown horizontally, as shown.
content.question: If the stones are thrown at the same time and air resistance is negligible, which of the following is true?

choices.label: The two stones reach the ground at the same time with the same speed.
The two stones reach the ground at the same time but with different speeds.
Stone <math alttext="A" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math> reaches the ground first, but the two stones have the same speed just before they hit the ground.
Stone <math alttext="A" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math> reaches the ground first and has greater speed just before hitting the ground.

content.answer: Stone <math alttext="A" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math> reaches the ground first, but the two stones have the same speed just before they hit the ground.
